00037 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS ***********************/
00039 #define BUFFER_SIZE                             0x40
00040 #define SPI_DATABIT_SIZE                10
00041 
00042 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00043 uint8_t menu1[] =
00044 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00045 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00046 "SPI demo \n\r"
00047 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00048 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00049 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200bps \n\r"
00050 "\t An example of SPI using interrupt mode to test the SPI driver \n\r"
00051 " This example uses SPI in slave mode to communicate with SPI slave device \n\r"
00052 " The master and slave transfer together a number of data byte \n\r"
00053 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00054 uint8_t menu2[] = "Demo terminated! \n\r";

00056 // SPI Configuration structure variable
00057 SPI_CFG_Type SPI_ConfigStruct;
00058 
00059 #if (SPI_DATABIT_SIZE == 8)
00060 uint8_t Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00061 uint8_t Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00062 #else
00063 uint16_t Tx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00064 uint16_t Rx_Buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
00065 #endif
00066

00070 void Buffer_Init(void);
00071 void Error_Loop(void);

00074 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00075 /*********************************************************************/
00080 void Buffer_Init(void)
00081 {
00082         uint8_t i;
00083 #if (SPI_DATABIT_SIZE == 8)
00084         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE; i++) {
00085                 Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00086                 Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00087         }
00088 #else
00089         for (i = 0; i < BUFFER_SIZE/2; i++) {
00090                 Tx_Buf[i] = i;
00091                 Rx_Buf[i] = 0;
00092         }
00093 #endif
00094 }
00095 
00096 /*********************************************************************/
00101 void Error_Loop(void)
00102 {
00103         /* Loop forever */
00104         while (1);
00105 }
00106 
00107 
00108 /*********************************************************************/
00113 void Buffer_Verify(void)
00114 {
00115         uint8_t i;
00116 #if (DATA_SIZE==8)
00117         uint8_t *src_addr = (uint8_t *) &Tx_Buf[0];
00118         uint8_t *dest_addr = (uint8_t *) &Rx_Buf[0];
00119         for ( i = 0; i < SPI_DATABIT_SIZE; i++ )
00120         {
00121                 if ( *src_addr++ != *dest_addr++ )
00122                 {
00123                         /* Call Error Loop */
00124                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00125                         Error_Loop();
00126                 }
00127         }
00128 #else
00129         uint16_t *src_addr = (uint16_t *) &Tx_Buf[0];
00130         uint16_t *dest_addr = (uint16_t *) &Rx_Buf[0];
00131         for ( i = 0; i < SPI_DATABIT_SIZE/2; i++ )
00132         {
00133                 if ( *src_addr++ != *dest_addr++ )
00134                 {
00135                         /* Call Error Loop */
00136                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00137                         Error_Loop();
00138                 }
00139         }
00140 #endif
00141 }

00151         _DBG(menu1);
00152 }

00156 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00157 /*********************************************************************/
00162 int c_entry(void)
00163 {
00164         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00165         SPI_DATA_SETUP_Type xferConfig;
00166 
00167         /*
00168          * Initialize SPI pin connect
00169          * P0.15 - SCK;
00170          * P0.16 - SSEL
00171          * P0.17 - MISO
00172          * P0.18 - MOSI
00173          */
00174         PinCfg.Funcnum = 3;
00175         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00176         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00177         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00178         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00179         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00180         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00181         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00182         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00183         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00184         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00185         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00186 
00187         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00188          * – 115200bps
00189          * – 8 data bit
00190          * – No parity
00191          * – 1 stop bit
00192          * – No flow control
00193          */
00194         debug_frmwrk_init();
00195 
00196         // print welcome screen
00197         print_menu();
00198 
00199         SPI_ConfigStruct.CPHA = SPI_CPHA_SECOND;
00200         SPI_ConfigStruct.CPOL = SPI_CPOL_LO;
00201         SPI_ConfigStruct.ClockRate = 2000000;
00202         SPI_ConfigStruct.DataOrder = SPI_DATA_MSB_FIRST;
00203         SPI_ConfigStruct.Databit = SPI_DATABIT_SIZE;
00204         SPI_ConfigStruct.Mode = SPI_SLAVE_MODE;
00205         // Initialize SPI peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00206         SPI_Init(LPC_SPI, &SPI_ConfigStruct);
00207 
00208 
00209         /* Initialize Buffer */
00210         _DBG("Init buffer...");
00211         Buffer_Init();
00212         _DBG_("Complete!"); _DBG_("Wait for master transfer data...");
00213         xferConfig.tx_data = Tx_Buf;
00214         xferConfig.rx_data = Rx_Buf;
00215         xferConfig.length = BUFFER_SIZE;
00216         SPI_ReadWrite(LPC_SPI, &xferConfig, SPI_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00217         _DBG_("Transfer complete!");
00218 
00219         // Verify buffer after transferring
00220         Buffer_Verify();
00221         _DBG_("Verify complete!");
00222 
00223     /* Loop forever */
00224         SPI_DeInit(LPC_SPI);
00225     while(1);
00226     return 1;
00227 }
00228 
00229 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00230    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00231    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00232    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00233    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00234 int main(void)
00235 {
00236     return c_entry();
00237 }
